== Ubuntu-be.org 2008 kickoff meeting ==

Sunday Jan 06 2008 starting at 9.15

=== Location ===
* @ IndyMedia office, Haachtsesteenweg / Chaussée de Haecht 51, Schaarbeek
* MarkVandenBorre has taken care of practical arrangements with IndyMedia people.
* Easy to reach by public transport (15' walk from Brussels north station)
* <nowiki>[[http://maps.google.be/maps?f=q&hl=nl&geocode=&q=Haachtse+Steenweg+51%2FN21+%4050.855880,+4.368550&sll=50.857462,4.368567&sspn=0.010945,0.030727&ie=UTF8&ll=50.857462,4.368567&spn=0.010945,0.030727&z=15&iwloc=addr&om=1|Map]]</nowiki> 

=== Reports ===
  See below

=== Participating ===
* ** IF YOU WANT TO JOIN US, PLEASE SMS MARK YOUR NAME ASAP AT +32 486961726; 25 PEOPLE IS THE LIMIT ***
* please bring a wifi equiped laptop with gobby (collaborative editor) installed
* if possible, please also bring a power strip, power cable, ethernet cable, switch
* confirmed: BenjaminSion, MarkVanDenBorre, FrancoisCauwe, ChristopheVandeplas, SebastianSchauenburg, PierreBuyle, JanClaeys, DieterVanderfaeillie (morning), AlexandreLaurent, BartBroeckx, KoenWybo, Koen Vervloesem, StephanvanIngen, David Geens, KevinElaerts, RobVanDyck (morning)
* to be confirmed: CédricJanssens, GlennSouth
* unfortunately not able to make it: PieterVerledens, PierreVorhagen, RoelHuybrechts, WouterHorré, AnneliesBollen, BenoîtPlunus, DennisKaarsemaker, WesleyStessens

=== Schedule ===
(<nowiki>[[/how_this_schedule_was_decided]]</nowiki>)
* 9.00 AM: MarkVandenBorre, ChristopheVandeplas, FrançoisCauwe and DieterVanderfaeillie prepare the room
* 9.15-9.45: participants starts trickling in.
* 10.00-10.20: <nowiki>[[/short intro]]</nowiki> (MarkVandenBorre)
* 10.30-11.30:
** session 1A: <nowiki>[[/use_of_ubuntu_in_education]]</nowiki> (DieterVanderfaeillie)
** session 1B: <nowiki>[[/support_points_map]]</nowiki> (PierreBuyle)
* 11.30-12.30:
** session 2A: <nowiki>[[/fairs_-_past_&_plans]]</nowiki> (MarkVandenBorre)
** session 2B: <nowiki>[[/promotional_materials]]</nowiki> (FrancoisCauwe)
* 12.30-14.00: noon break
* 14.00-15.00:
** session 3A: <nowiki>[[/cooperation_with_nl,_fr,_de]]</nowiki> (SebastianSchauenburg tbc)
** session 3B: <nowiki>[[/coordination_within_ubuntu-be.org]]</nowiki>: fr-nl-de, private information,... (ChristopheVandeplas tbc)
* 15.00-16.00:
** session 4A: <nowiki>[[/ubuntu 8.04 lts and press]]</nowiki> (KoenVervloesem tbc)
** session 4B: <nowiki>[[/website]]</nowiki>
* 16.00-16.30: short break
* 16.30-17.30:
** session 5A: <nowiki>[[/education on ubuntu]]</nowiki> (KoenWybo )
** session 5B: <nowiki>[[/PR_in_general]]</nowiki>
* 17.30-18.00: <nowiki>[[/closing_discussion]]</nowiki> (MarkVandenBorre) + cleanup
* food with interested participants

=== Logistics ===
* ChristopheVandeplas will take care of food & drinks
** refund from ubuntu-be.org war chest
** donations appreciated!

=== Subjects to pick from for the schedule ===

==== Internal PR/coordination ====
* Internal education of ubuntu-be.org members/Learning to evangelise. --> Chri, François
* Support point maps: Develop drupal / future?
* support points map: maintenance, cleaning up cruft: --> Mark
* coordination belgium project (FR_BE, NL_BE, DE_BE): --> Chri, François, Mark, Wesley
* Fundraising
* Release parties --> Wesley, Bart Broeckx
* Ubuntu-be.org website --> Pieter (see wiki), Wesley, Mark
* Fair evaluation and future planning: Dipro / FOSDEM (before noon?) --> Chri, Dieter, JanC, Mark
* private contacts list for ubuntu-be.org staff (press contacts, ...)
* Press contacts (LTS !)
* recruiting new active members --> François
* event planners team?
* planet: ubuntu-be.org members blog aggregation

* Educating people on ubuntu
* Promoting use in education (before noon?) --> François, Chri, Dieter Mark

* Marketing actions --> Chri, François 
* contacts with NL, FR, DE --> JanC, Sebastian, Mark, Wesley
** preferably, we need at least 1 participant who has some experience with ubuntu-fr!

==== Material & knowledge buildup ====
* localized CD --> JanC, Pieter (i wont be there, but i'll post something on the wiki), Wesley
* Eventbox
* educational materials

* female participation --> JanC (but I want at least 2 females attending too! ;) )
